results.title: Empire of the sun [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Robert Shapiro
results.brief_description: Jim Graham, a young Briton living a comfortable life in Shanghai, is separated from his parents following the Japanese invasion of China at the start of World War II. The separation leads to Jim being caught in an internment camp where he has to fend for himself. Cast includes John Malkovich, Christian Bale, Miranda Richardson and Nigel Havers. Based on the autobiographical novel by J. G. Ballard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Robert Shapiro

results.title: Empire of passion = Ai no Borei = Phantom of love
results.creator_credit: Nagisa Oshima, Anatole Dauman, Argos Films and Oshima Productions
results.brief_description: Following the world-wide success of his highly erotic and controversial ‘Ai No Corrida’ (The Realm of the Senses) in 1976, Oshima directed a companion piece, ‘Empire of Passion’, but this time set in late 19th century rural Japan. Toyoji (Tatsuya Fuji), a soldier, returns from the first Chinese War and embarks on a passionate affair with Seki (Kazuko Yoshiyuki), a woman twenty years his senior and married to a hard-drinking rickshaw man. They soon conspire to murder the husband and throw his body down a disused well. Three years later, the husband’s ghost returns to haunt the lovers, thus hastening their downfall. Like much of Oshima’s work the film is based on facts. It also follows Oshima’s defiant stance against Japan’s strict censorship laws and moral codes. However, ‘Ai No Borei’ is less concerned with steamy eroticism than the aftermath of an all consuming passion, namely the devastating effect of guilt. ‘Ai No Borei’ is a straight forward crime of passion story in the vein of ‘The Postman Always Rings Twice’ with the added thrill of an Asian ghost story. Adapted from a novel by Itoko Namura, ‘Ai No Borei’ is also known as ‘Phantom of Love’. Nagisa Oshima was awarded the Best Director Prize at the Cannes Film Festival in 1978. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Empire Games, 1962
results.brief_description: The official film of the 7th Empire Games held at Perth, Western Australia. H.R.H. Prince Philip attended the Games. This is a colorful and fascinating piece of Australian history featuring a very young Dawn Fraser in action.

results.title: Emphysema: the facts
results.creator_credit: Richard Bluestein, Amram Nowak Associates and American Lung Association
results.brief_description: The function of normal lungs is shown and the processes due to cigarette smoking which affect the lung and cause emphysema. Normal lungs are shown and compared with lungs from an emphysema patient. Treatments, which can only alleviate the symptoms, are shown

results.title: Emotions of every day living. No. 6. First lessons
results.creator_credit: Frank Beckwith, Howard A. Lesser, Knickerbocker Productions and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: A teacher is faced with many problems when an aggressive child becomes a member of her second grade class. The disrupting influence of the new boy, whose emotional difficulties lead him to bully the other children, is skilfully dealt with by the understanding teacher who not only helps the boy, but restores balance in the classroom by helping the other children handle their feelings. A problem in group dynamics is solved by adjustment which gives the children insight into the feelings that lie behind their actions.

results.title: Emotions of every-day living. No. 3. Fears of children
results.creator_credit: Francis Thompson, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A film about Paul, a normal five-year-old and his well-intentioned parents. In a series of episodes typical of those arising in families with small children, it shows how Paul’s fears are related to his feelings about his parents. Fears not only prevent him from enjoying experiences other boys enjoy, but tend to widen the gap of mnisunderstanding between him and his parents. The film points out that Paul’s feelings are common to children of his age and may be accentuated when parents become either unduly protective or over severe.

results.title: Emotional aspects of pregnancy
results.creator_credit: Sally Marschall, Phillip Koch and Joshua Productions
results.brief_description: Prepares the expectant mother and father for emotional changes, highlighting the experiences of two expectant couples and of one single expectant mother. During pregnancy, the woman’s feelings become more intense. The man’s feelings change also. Relationships with family and friends take on new dimensions. Both need reassurance that they are loved.
